page.title: 07St. Nicholas Church (p.1)
page.content: The Church in Wrea Green is called St., Nicholas; it is about 100 years old. It has a small linked church at Ballam. The present Vicar has been taking services here for 16 years. He has between 20 and 24 people in the choir. Some of these choristers have sung in cathedrals all over the country as they have a very high reputation. In the church is an interesting reredos behind the altar which was brought back from Italy by one of the local landowning families. Part of the Vicar's work is to visit the Hospital at Moss Side which is 3Km away. This hospital is only small and is used for patients recovering from operations and long illnesses. Two other ministers from local churches also visit the hospital.
